page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: With the increasing private ownership of cars, the need for public transport declined to the extent where it has become almost non_existent. There are buses night & morning which cater for some people working out of the area & students at Nuneaton Colleges. Shoppers' buses also serve the villages on certain days, but no public transport as such is available. Very few families have no can at all and 75% have two cars. The majority of these are privately owned although in some 2 car families one of the vehicles is a firm's car.One or two families have caravanettes & horse_boxes to aid their leisure pursuits. There is no passenger train service in the area.
